Current Implementation

Planned Implementation

There are two ways how the player defines where to go.

  • Go to a Coordinate
  • Go to an Entity

Go to a Coordinate

The player defines the <x,y,z> coordinate of where he wants to walk. The server will transmit to all player the start and destination position as well as the walking speed. Each client will then adapt this movement to the lagged position they know of the player that the entity will reach the destination in time. (e.g. walk faster if the player is farrer away from the destination on the client than on the server)

Go to an Entity

This works like 'Go to a Coordinate' with the difference that the destination is an entity that may move on its own, so the the follower entity's movement is updated according to the target entity's movement.

Ideas

Walk to known areas

This basically takes #2.1 and #2.2 a bit further by allowing the player to let the character walk to known places. These known places can include shops, landmarks, specially marked areas by the player, and others. This requires a bit of AI to do the walking for the player. The method of walking could simply be a step by step version of #2.1 which will automagicly select its new goto coordinate. The player should ofcourse be able to stop this operation for when he is attacked on his route or just changes his mind.
